text:
'We propose here a ventilator design to be integrated into a hospital environment. The HEV (High Energy physics community Ventilator) concept is based on components which are simple and cheap to source, complies with hospital standards for external connections and operating modes, and supports the most requested operation modes. The starting point of the design is the set of MHRA (Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency) guidelines provided by the UK government regarding Rapidly Manufactured Ventilator Systems [13]. The proposal here is, at this stage, not a medically approved system and will need a process of verification with medical experts. However, in the interests of rapid development the concept is presented to generate feedback, corrections, and support as the project progresses. A demonstrator has been built and the design is now in the prototyping stage.'
High Energy physics community Ventilator (HEV) design and prototype from CERN <https://arxiv.org/pdf/2004.00534.pdf?fbclid=IwAR3_XdRfi197BeNViH9y5De_Y0_kglhrVy_kWHgljzbzEUFd3BQfO9iA5VA>

text: urban(vertical) farming is something that should be considered to deal with the expected food supply shortage. The homeless can be moved to schools or any space/land the government is willing to provide for those in need at a time of crisis. it is really simple, requires minimum skill and is a great way to up cycle plastic bottles. A safety net program(PSNP) is already in place in many cities across the country and i think that is where it should start.

attachments.title: 13 Plastic Bottle Vertical Garden Ideas
attachments.text: These 13 plastic bottle vertical garden ideas will interest you if you are a creative person, DIY lover and love to grow plants.
attachments.fallback: Balcony Garden Web: 13 Plastic Bottle Vertical Garden Ideas

attachments.title: Italian Engineers Turn Snorkeling Masks Into Life-Saving Ventilators
attachments.text: Even though China maintained the outbreak of COVID-19 within the country, other countries such as the USA and Italy became the new hotspots for the virus. As the number of infected rises rapidly in these countries, the demand for specialists that are qualified and equipment is increasing as well. Due to the deficit of equipment, ISINNOVA engineers have made it their job to try and solve these problems. These engineers have teamed up with medical experts and Decathlon to alter full-face snorkeling masks into masks which can be added to medical breathing machines. This will help many people that are infected with the COVID-19 virus and require breathing equipment. With the shortages of breathing masks worldwide, this genius conversion couldn’t come in a better time. Dr. Renato Favero, former head physician at the Gardone Valtrompia Hospital approached the engineers Alessandro Romaiol and Cristian Fracassi of the Italian engineering company, ISINNOVA. Dr. Renato had the idea to soften the shortage of C-PAP masks which became a deficit since the corona outbreak. The hospitals are using C-PAP masks for sub-intensive therapy. When COVID-19 reached Italy (first confirmed case on January 29 this year), the need for these masks increased. Due to the short supply of these masks, Dr. Favero suggested modifying already available masks used by scuba divers into the masks that can be used by ventilating machines. Decathlon, a sporting goods retailer, rose to the challenge and was included in the project as the producer and supplier for the Easybreath snorkeling masks. After they got involved, ISINNOVA took the CAD designs for the snorkeling masks and used them to create the needed modifications. They also included the designs and 3D printing of Charlotte and Dave valves which are the parts that connect the masks to the breathing machine tubes. ISINNOVA made a statement on their web page that tests were made on the prototype on one of their colleagues in Chiari Hospital. The test came out successful and the hospital later tested the prototype on a patient in need. The modified ventilation mask worked perfectly and the doctors that tested it were very satisfied. The blueprints and instructions on how to make the masks were made available online for free by ISINNOVA. Hospitals can now buy the Easybreath snorkeling masks from Decathlon for €25 instead of their normal price which starts at around €100. The valves they can 3D print on their own. Not only does this lessen the solution for the mask crisis, but it also helps the hospitals and governments from lots of additional expenses. There’s also a 5-step video tutorial posted on YouTube with details for the assembly of the masks. <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w4Csqdxkrfw> Even though this is amazing news, there is one setback. Snorkeling experts claim that the full face masks can be dangerous due to the buildup of carbon dioxide inside of the mask. This can happen if an improper air outtake is provided. Additionally, the mask shortage is not the only thing that needs to be solved at the moment. There’s also a shortage of ventilators for people to use. The engineering company made a note that the masks should be used if they are necessary since the mask and the link valves are not certified. Statements on their website read that the masks are made for hospitals and other healthcare facilities in difficult situations where there’s no alternative for supplies.
attachments.fallback: Italian Engineers Turn Snorkeling Masks Into Life-Saving Ventilators
